featuresSection.heading: Explore Optimal Residential Plot Sizes and Smart Investment Opportunities in Sector 120
description: The diverse offerings of Plot For Sale in Sector 120 cater to various needs from first-time homeowners looking for manageable space to investors seeking high-yield land parcels. Understanding the size and potential use of the land is critical to maximizing your investment value. We guide you through the ideal dimensions for construction and future appreciation.

Sector 120 plots are strategically located near planned infrastructure developments promising exponential growth in the coming years. Select the ideal plot size that aligns with your architectural goals and financial plan ensuring you capitalize on the dynamic real estate market of Noida.

faqSection.title: Common Questions About Buying a Plot in Sector 120 Noida
faqSection.description: We address the most frequent queries buyers have regarding legal approvals, financing, possession, and the investment viability of property in Sector 120.

faqs.question: What is the typical size range of a Plot For Sale in Sector 120 Noida
faqs.answer: Plots in Sector 120 generally range from 4 Marla (ideal for small homes) up to 14 Marla or larger for premium development projects. The availability depends heavily on the specific residential block and the society's master plan. We recommend prioritizing plots that are approved by the relevant development authority to ensure standardization of size and construction norms. This variance in size allows investors and homeowners to find land that perfectly matches their budget and architectural goals within this high-growth sector.

faqs.question: Are the plots in Sector 120 approved by the Noida Authority or RERA
faqs.answer: It is crucial to verify the approval status for any Plot For Sale in Sector 120. Most reputable plots and associated society developments should be approved by the Noida Authority or, if part of a larger planned township, be RERA registered. RERA registration ensures transparency, project timeline adherence, and provides legal protection for the buyer. Always request to see the clear approval documentation and land use certificates before finalizing the purchase agreement.

faqs.question: What documentation is required to purchase a residential plot here
faqs.answer: The essential documents include the registered Sale Deed, the Mutation Certificate (for transfer of title), the Encumbrance Certificate (EC) confirming no legal liabilities, and the approved layout plan. For the buyer, standard KYC documents such as PAN card, Aadhar card, and photographs are required. Thoroughly checking the Chain of Title is also recommended to ensure the property's history is clear and undisputed prior to the final registration process.

faqs.question: Can I obtain a bank loan for a Plot For Sale in Sector 120
faqs.answer: Yes, securing financing for plots in Sector 120 is straightforward provided the property has clear titles and is located in an approved residential area. Major banks and financial institutions offer specialized land loans (plot loans). Loan eligibility usually depends on the buyer's financial profile and the bank's assessment of the land's legal standing and valuation. We can connect you with trusted banking partners experienced in funding land purchases in Noida.

faqs.question: What are the current property taxes and maintenance charges in Sector 120
faqs.answer: Property taxes are calculated based on the plot area, circle rate, and the usage (residential or commercial). These are typically managed by the local municipal corporation or the relevant development authority. If the plot is part of a gated community, there will also be monthly maintenance charges covering common area security, street lighting, and utility upkeep. These charges vary and should be clarified upfront with the seller or society management.

faqs.question: What is the typical time frame for plot possession and registry after purchase
faqs.answer: If you are purchasing a ready-for-possession Plot For Sale in Sector 120 with clear titles, the registry process can typically be completed within 30 to 60 days depending on local sub-registrar office scheduling and document verification speed. Physical possession is usually handed over immediately upon successful registration of the Sale Deed, allowing you to commence construction planning without delay.

faqs.question: Is Sector 120 prone to water logging or foundational issues
faqs.answer: Sector 120, being part of a planned development, has dedicated storm drainage and well-managed water systems designed to prevent water logging during the monsoon season. Most plots are on elevated and solid ground, minimizing foundational risk. However, it is always wise to consult a local civil engineer or structural expert for a site assessment specific to the plot you are considering for purchase.

faqs.question: What amenities and facilities are close to the residential plots
faqs.answer: Sector 120 benefits from excellent social infrastructure. Essential amenities nearby include reputed schools like Sapphire International School, major hospitals, large shopping centers, and easy access to both the Delhi Metro and major highways. The locality is rapidly maturing into a self-sufficient residential ecosystem perfect for families.

faqs.question: Can foreigners or NRIs buy a Plot For Sale in Sector 120 Noida
faqs.answer: Yes, Non-Resident Indians (NRIs) can generally purchase both residential and commercial plots in India subject to FEMA regulations. Foreign citizens of non-Indian origin usually require special permission from the Reserve Bank of India (RBI). We advise NRIs and foreign buyers to utilize specialized legal counsel to ensure compliance with all Indian regulatory requirements related to land acquisition.

faqs.question: Are there specific construction guidelines or height restrictions in Sector 120
faqs.answer: Yes, construction in Sector 120 is governed by the Noida Authority's master plan and building bylaws. These regulations dictate permissible ground coverage, Floor Area Ratio (FAR), setback requirements, and maximum building height. These rules ensure uniformity and safety across the sector. Compliance is mandatory for obtaining completion certificates after construction is finished.
